title: Is the US trying to stall China in the 5G global implementation so as to give them time to develop their own as they are still far behind and meanwhile to force us all to use their 4G to milk as much money as they can with it? - Quora

response.answer_text: We all know that American intelligence agencies monitor every single form of communication they can. Snowden and Assange proved this to be true. I believe the only problem that the US has with Huawei is that they CAN’T intercept Huawei traffic and that has to be a No No for the US. If they can’t intercept everything then it has to be banned, blocked, and accused of anything and everything that may impede their ability to hack every communication made anywhere in the world. - China has already deployed 5G in every major Chinese city and they are looking to deploy 5G across the nation. They lead in 6G patents as they have been working on that as well. - One of the problems I see with Western nations is that they seem to hang onto old equipment to make as much profit from sunk cost as they can. This means that they are often using old equipment, old processes, and old ideas whereas China is a newly developed nation with new equipment, new ideas, new unserviced markets, etc.

I’m not sure the US is trying to buy time to develop their own 5G technology. Practically speaking, they really can’t compete in this area — they’re too far behind the eight ball. Rather, I think they’re just trying to hamstring the Chinese. It’s a common tactic: if you can’t compete, then sabotage your competitor. Recall the Tonya Harding/Nancy Kerrigan story. This is typical American mentality.
